intro: Phthirusa percrassa, commonly known as the roughleaf phthirusa, is a species of flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, white flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or dry soils and is adapted to harsh alpine environments. Its botanical features include a taproot system and a distinctive, branched stem structure. It is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
